com.yantra.api.omp.order

Interface getStoreAvailability

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.OMPApi, YIFApi

    public interface getStoreAvailability

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document getStoreAvailability(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The getStoreAvailability API can be used to find availabilities for picking up at the store or node(s) or for shipping to home.

    • Method Detail

      • getStoreAvailability

        org.w3c.dom.Document getStoreAvailability(YFSEnvironment env,
                                          org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                   throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                          java.rmi.RemoteException

        The getStoreAvailability API can be used to find availabilities for picking up at the store or node(s) or for shipping to home.

        The getStoreAvailability API can support the following options:

        • Current availability for pickup in the store.
        • Current availability for pickup in a requested set of stores/nodes.
        • Availability for pickup from current store/surrounding stores/nodes based on procurement through standard transfer.
        • Availability for pickup from current store/surrounding stores/nodes based on procurement through a transfer using expedited services (this is considered only for items that can be parcel shipped from the DC to the store).
        • Shipments to home from DC.
        • Special orders (for special order items).
        • Ship direct to home from the vendor.
        • Pickup at the store after it is procured from the vendor.
        • Support for backorder based on item lead-time for procurement from vendor.

        Note: Inventory supplies and demands of the item at the nodes that are being marked as having incorrect inventory picture will not be considered in getStoreAvailability logic when inventory checks are performed. This is also true for nodes that have infinite inventory.

        Note: Availability across multiple inventory items (such as Items with Variation and GTIN) are not read for this API.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        See also: Additional Information

        User Exits:

          com.yantra.ycm.japi.ue.YCMGetItemDetailsUE
          com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetDeliveryLeadTimeUE

        Events Raised: None

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions:None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Partial.

        Database Extensibility Support: No

        Additional Information

        Getting current availability for pickup options.
        For each Line in the input (PromiseLine element), the following steps will be executed according to the fulfillment types provided.

        • 1. The API will first check for stock in the current store and list of alternate nodes passed. Supplies are checked for the demand type passed but if not passed, OPEN_ORDER demand will be used to find the appropriate supplies. This step is skipped for the current store if ConsiderCurrentStoreInventory is passed as 'N'. (This attribute will NOT suppress in store inventory for alternate stores)
        • 2. For any quantities that are not available at a store, system will try standard transfer to the store. Inventory availability will be looked up with the Standard Transfer Fulfillment Type. It is expected that sourcing rules for this fulfillment type will be set up with "Receiving node" as the store.
        • 3. For any quantities that are not available after the above step, system will try procurement with the Expedited Transfer Fulfillment Type. It is expected that sourcing rules for this fulfillment type will be set up with "Receiving node" as the store. When computing transfer times for expedited fulfillment, the default carrier service for transfer will be used. If there is no default carrier service for transfer, transfer schedules between the procurement node and the store will be used. Expedited procurement is tried only for items that can be shipped through parcel service.
        • 4. For any quantities that still could not be fulfilled from the above steps, system will try to source inventory using the Special Order Fulfillment Type. This will be tried with the Store as the "Receiving Node". Node's attributes, CanShipToStore and CanShipToDC, will be used to control whether the special order vendor can ship to the Store or DC. Note: This control applies to ALL sourcing. If ConsiderSpecialOrderOnly is passed as 'Y', steps 1, 2 and 3 are not performed for special order items.
        • 5. For all lines that still could not be fulfilled from all of the above steps, system will assume that the primary DC can procure this item on the end-of-day of the day that current day + item's lead time falls into. For example, current date/time is 4/6/2004 17:00:00 and lead time is 1 day. The assumption date/time will be 4/8/2004 00:00:00. The transit days between the DC and the store will then be factored in as part of the pickup date calculation. The backordered pickup options will also have Backordered flag set to Y. The Primary DC will be determined by running the sourcing algorithm with the Standard Transfer Fulfillment Type with the inventory check turns off.

        Note: For pickup options found in step 2, 3, 4, and 5, the receipt processing time and receiving calendar of the store or node will be considered in determining the pickup date. In addition, the store/node's shipping calendar will be considered in determining the final pickup date. This also applies to the pickup options found in step 1.

        Getting current availability for ship to home options.
        Irrespective of results of pickup at store, system will evaluate ship to home options. For each Line in the input, the following steps will be executed. Note: this will only be performed if the ShipToHomeFulfillmentType and ShipToAddress are specified. If ShipToAddress is specified at the Promise level, it will be defaulted to the PromiseLine if none is specified.

        • 1. Ship Nodes will be determined using the Ship To Home Fulfillment Type for the Ship To Address on each line. The carrier service passed will be used for transit time calculations.
        • 2. For any quantities that still could not be fulfilled from the above steps, system will try to source inventory using the Special Order Fulfillment Type. This will be tried for the Ship To Address on each line. Node's attribute, CanShipToOtherAddresses, will be used to control whether the special order vendor can ship to the address. Note: This control applies to ALL sourcing. If ConsiderSpecialOrderOnly is passed as 'Y', steps 1 will not be performed for special order items.
        • 3. For any quantities not fulfilled through the above steps, system will find the best node (without inventory checks) using the Ship To Home Fulfillment Type and suggest the ship node and a date that can be met by assuming that the primary DC can procure the item on the end-of-day of the day that current day + item's lead time falls into. For example, current date/time is 4/6/2004 17:00:00 and lead time is 1 day. The assumption date/time will be 4/8/2004 00:00:00. The backordered ship to home options will also have a Backordered flag set to Y.

        For more details on sourcing, refer to findInventory api.
        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by createEnvironment.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.
        Returns:
        For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.
        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
